title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: The expected behavior is that when changing the data source for a data set, the children nodes should be listed.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Go to the data set editor page in the query tab.
3. Change the data source.

Actual result:
After changing the data source, there is no listing of children nodes in the data set editor page of the query tab. To see the children nodes, close the data set editor and reopen it.
